title: Marathon Petroleum Plans to Spin Off Gas Stations, May Shake Up Leaders
summary: Board discusses replacing CEO Gary Heminger, other executives, according to sources. Oil refiner Marathon Petroleum Corp. is preparing to spin off its gas-station chain and considering shaking up its executive leadership to appease activist shareholders, including Elliott Management Corp., according to people familiar with the matter.

title: GM and Toyota Back Trump Administration on Emissions Rules
summary: Auto industry divided over whether California can set its own regulations. Several major auto makers including General Motors Co. , Toyota Motor Corp. and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV are siding with the Trump administration in a lawsuit over its proposed rollback of new tailpipe-emissions rules for cars and trucks sold in the U.S.

title: Employees Ask Facebook to Reverse Policy on Political-Ad Fact-Checking
summary: A letter signed by 250 employees argues that candidates' ads should not be exempt from checks. A group of Facebook Inc. employees asked the company to reverse its policy of exempting political candidates' ads from its own fact-checking program, calling the controversial rules a betrayal of the social-media giant's values.

title: Former Alstom Executive Challenges Reach of U.S. Foreign Bribery Law
summary: At the start of Lawrence Hoskins's trial Monday, his lawyers attacked prosecutors' interpretation of a key definition in the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. NEW HAVEN, Conn.-A former Alstom SA executive mounted a direct challenge to the long reach of the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act on Monday, the first day of a trial in a case that has raised legal questions about who is subject to the foreign bribery law.

title: 'Why Is This Airplane Still Flying?' The FAA Missteps That Kept Boeing's MAX Aloft
summary: Resume Subscription. Just after a Boeing Co. 737 MAX jet crashed in Indonesia a year ago, FAA officials asked themselves: Should they warn the world the entire fleet could have a design flaw?

title: Housing Highlights Promises, Limits of Fed's 'Insurance' Rate Cuts
summary: Sales have rebounded as mortgage rates declined, but trade uncertainty has damped the benefit of lower borrowing costs in other sectors. When Federal Reserve officials started cutting interest rates over the summer, they framed the moves as akin to taking out insurance for the economy-steps aimed at providing some support at a time of rising risks.

title: State Court Prohibits Use of North Carolina Congressional Map for 2020 Elections
summary: Three-judge panel said district lines drawn by GOP appeared to be unlawful partisan gerrymander. A panel of North Carolina judges on Monday blocked the state from using a Republican-drawn congressional map for the 2020 elections, stepping in after the U.S. Supreme Court declined to referee the matter.

title: Google's Ad Business Hums Along Though Profit Falls
summary: Profit at Alphabet drops 23%, hurt by investment losses. Quarterly results from Google showed the complexity of operating its internet empire, as steady growth in online advertising sales was overshadowed by rising costs and a weak performance from some long-held company investments.

title: House to Vote on a Road Map for Its Impeachment Inquiry
summary: Announcement follows failure by impeachment witness Charles Kupperman, Trump's former deputy national security adviser, to appear for interview in inquiry. WASHINGTON-The House plans to vote on a resolution laying out Democrats' next steps in the impeachment inquiry into President Trump and move to a public phase of the investigation, the first significant vote since the probe began.

title: Tens of Thousands Flee Los Angeles Blaze
summary: Utility companies prepare for another week of mandatory blackouts; PG&E says its power lines may have caused small fires over the weekend. LOS ANGELES-Tens of thousands of residents evacuated their homes as a fast-moving blaze swept through the nation's second largest city and utility companies planned another week of widespread blackouts amid forecasts of strong, dangerous winds.

title: China Investors Keep Making Deals in Silicon Valley Amid Pushback
summary: The moves highlight a resilient relationship amid Washington's efforts to curb foreign access to sensitive technology. Chinese investors are pressing ahead with investments into startups and venture-capital funds, emboldened in part by ambiguities in U.S. efforts to limit foreign access to technology deals.

title: IMF to Test Argentina's New Leader
summary: President-elect Alberto Fernández must reconcile his campaign-spending promises with the strict fiscal demands of the International Monetary Fund. After defeating his political rival in Argentina's presidential election, President-elect Alberto Fernández now faces another adversary and longtime nemesis of the nationalist Peronist movement: the International Monetary Fund.

title: California vs. the Constitution
summary: Sacramento can't run its own foreign policy on climate change.. Democrats in California believe they can impose their laws on the rest of the country, and they even think they can ignore the Constitution when it conflicts with their progressive policies. Credit to the Justice Department for attempting to make clear that California isn't a separate nation under the law, and that climate change isn't a license for a state to conduct its own foreign policy.

title: Pelosi Concedes on Inquiry Vote
summary: A House impeachment resolution is the start of political accountability.. Vindication is overrated, but we'll take it in the case of a House vote to authorize an impeachment inquiry. We're referring to Speaker Nancy Pelosi's letter Monday to fellow Democrats that she'll offer a resolution on the House floor this week that will set the terms of its impeachment investigation.

title: The Fed Needs Trust, Not Tactics
summary: Interest-rate cuts won't hold off the next downturn. The central bank must assure markets with a plan.. There's nothing soft about soft power.

title: Tiffany Acquisition Would Be LVMH's Most Challenging Yet
summary: LVMH's chief executive, Bernard Arnault, faces rejuvenating the U.S. jewelry company. PARIS-In targeting Tiffany & Co, French billionaire Bernard Arnault is attempting his most challenging acquisition in more than three decades of deal making.

title: 'Vicksburg' Review: Breaking the Confederacy
summary: "The Yankees . . . are worse than the Goth and Vandals of the middle ages," wrote one Confederate soldier. The feeling was mutual.. The first week in July 1863 was disastrous for the Confederacy. The Battle of Gettysburg, ending July 3, was, as we know, a great Union victory. Lee's Army of Northern Virginia was forced to retreat from Pennsylvania and would never again be on the offensive. The Eastern theater would soon turn into a slow, bloody war of attrition, one that the South, with inferior resources, couldn't hope to win militarily. The taking of Vicksburg, Miss., on July 4, 1863, by Ulysses S. Grant's Army of the Tennessee, was a smaller campaign, if measured by the number of troops involved and the number of casualties. But it was equally momentous, and it had greater immediate effects.

title: Lukewarm Bond Yields Belie Mayors' Climate Alarm
summary: If politicians believe what they say on the campaign trail, why don't their cities disclose it to borrowers?. Dire climate-change warnings have become a mainstay of politics. This is particularly true for state and local politicians whose coastal constituents stand to be most affected by rising sea levels. Mayors declare that impending eco-dangers represent an "existential threat," and that significant portions of their cities will be submerged without swift and dramatic action. But do municipalities disclose these perilous environmental risks to potential bond investors?

title: The Military Shouldn't Shave Its Numbers
summary: Allowing beards could help bolster the ranks, and at no cost too.. For the first time in more than a decade, the Army missed its recruiting target last year. Given that the job market is competitive and only 29% of 17- to 24-year-olds meet entry standards, according to Pentagon data, something has to change. It's time to bring in the beards.

title: A Dissident Outlives Soviet Communism
summary: His book documenting Western complicity didn't find a U.S. publisher for almost 25 years.. Only death could silence Vladimir Bukovsky. His crusade against the Communist system in Russia and beyond, before and after the Berlin Wall's fall, was unequaled. He died Sunday at age 76 at his home in Cambridge, England, where he'd lived since the Soviet Union expelled him in 1976.

title: Trump's Unfairness Advantage
summary: Pelosi realizes Democrats' trampling of impeachment norms helps Trump.. In Nancy Pelosi's defiance of all House precedent, her dubious reliance on selective leaks of secret testimony to make her case, and her deference to Democrats who have been looking to impeach Donald Trump from the moment he was sworn in, the speaker now stands atop the most unprincipled presidential impeachment in U.S. history.

title: A Battle Won in the War on Terror
summary: Killing Baghdadi won't 'fix' the Middle East, but ISIS' failure is a crucial victory.. title: Big Four Audit Firms Sell Less Nonaudit Work to U.K. Audit Clients
summary: The finding comes ahead of potential new legislation that could reshape the industry. Big Four audit and accounting firms in the U.K. are selling less nonaudit work to their audit clients, a finding that comes as some lawmakers are recommending firms separate their audit and consulting businesses to avoid conflicts of interest.

title: AT&T Reaches Truce With Activist as TV Defections Worsen
summary: Elliott had challenged telecom giant's strategy; AT&T commits to regular share buybacks, plans to avoid major acquisitions. summary: Company gained 754,000 net postpaid phone customers in quarter, more than Verizon and AT&T combined. T-Mobile US Inc. attracted a higher number of lucrative cellphone subscribers than its rivals in the third quarter even as its merger with Sprint Corp. remained in limbo.

summary: Delivery company plans to spend more on promotions to counter rivals including DoorDash, Postmates. Grubhub Inc. said orders and customer growth are slowing as competition in the food-delivery business accelerates.

title: Man Pleads Guilty to All 23 Counts in Capital Gazette Massacre
summary: Five staffers were killed; insanity hearing is next. ANNAPOLIS, Md.-A Maryland man pleaded guilty Monday in the slayings of five staffers at an Annapolis newspaper, and a jury is expected to hear testimony within weeks about whether he wasn't responsible by reason of insanity.

title: Islamic State Spokesman Killed in U.S. Airstrike
summary: Abu al-Hassan al-Muhajir was targeted by the U.S. and Syrian Democratic Forces shortly after the death of ISIS leader Baghdadi. summary: Defense officials say data on Islamic State and its leaders will likely lead to more operations against militant group. title: Google's Spending Is Back in Season
summary: Parent company Alphabet's rising costs overwhelm its growth story. Say this much for Google: They are consistent about being inconsistent.

title: New York City Councilman Andy King Suspended Over Harassment Allegations
summary: Resume Subscription. The New York City Council voted Monday to suspend Councilman Andy King from his seat for 30 days over allegations he violated its anti-harassment policy, intimidated staff members and misused city dollars for a staff retreat in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

title: Beyond Meat Books First Profit as Competition Mounts
summary: Plant-based burger maker plans promotional push to help sustain sales growth. summary: Richard Branson's firm becomes first publicly traded space tourism company. summary: The bar was unusually high for the company's quarterly results. Beyond Meat on Monday reported what looked like excellent results. But excellent doesn't cut it for a stock this hyped.

title: Johnson Loses Bid for Early Election but Takes New Tack to Get One
summary: Prime minister hopes to get some opposition support for alternative route to a national vote in December. LONDON-A British general election remains likely this year as a way to resolve the Brexit stalemate, even though lawmakers on Monday blocked a bid by Prime Minister Boris Johnson to schedule an early ballot.

summary: Biographical show has had a strong run ahead of its official Broadway opening. In her decadeslong career, Tina Turner has sold millions of albums, won multiple Grammy Awards and gone on many a global concert tour.

title: S&P 500 Rises to a Record
summary: Nasdaq gains 1% on the day, finishes just below its record as investors look to earnings. The S&P 500 set a record for the first time in three months to kick off a busy week that features a flurry of corporate earnings, a Federal Reserve meeting and the October jobs report.

title: PG&E Pain Spreads to Utility's Bonds
summary: Concerns about potential liability related to California fires push company's bonds, stocks sharply lower. summary: After a brief retreat, tech stocks are back in charge of the market. Stocks rose broadly Monday, but it is a handful of big technology shares that have led the S&P 500 to its latest record.

summary: The sale at 220 Central Park South is viewed as a shot in the arm to the struggling ultra high-end market.. title: Grudge Match: House vs. Executive Privilege
summary: Nancy Pelosi has no more power than I do to launch an "impeachment inquiry" unless she does so as the speaker of the House of Representatives. She can't speak for the House without a vote, which she hasn't called.. Jean Galbraith and Michel Paradis take umbrage with President Trump's refusal to cooperate with Nancy Pelosi's "official impeachment inquiry" ("Impeachment Trumps Executive Privilege. Ask George Washington," op-ed, Oct. 23). The writers have impressive credentials but seem to have missed the salient point of President Trump's lack of cooperation: Nancy Pelosi has no more power on her own than I do to launch an impeachment inquiry. She can't speak for the House without a vote, which she hasn't called.

title: Competition Will Improve Rating Standards
summary: The North American rating oligopoly retains a more than 85% share of the European market a decade after the financial crisis.. We were astonished to find a columnist at The Wall Street Journal arguing that a lack of competition in the credit-rating sector is in the best interests of investors ("Beware Debt Ratings' Lower Bar," Heard on the Street, Oct. 8). The conclusion that there needs to be less, not more, competition in rating credit flies in the face of lessons of the global financial crisis and euro crisis, when investors and issuers were so reliant on three credit-rating agencies with similar approaches to risk analysis.

title: California Pols Have It Both Ways on High Gas Prices
summary: This is how socialism works, increase regulations until the private companies have to raise prices, then blame those companies for raising prices as the excuse to take them over or more regulations.. Regarding your editorial "California's Gasoline Panic" (Oct. 23): Liberal politicians in California tell us they want to tax fossil fuels out of existence, then when it hits their voters' pocketbooks, it's the fault of the evil free market and companies overcharging consumers for profit. This is how socialism works: Increase regulations until the private companies have to raise prices, then blame them for raising prices, using that as the excuse to take them over or regulate them more.

CHICAGO-The Justice Department for the first time will let police officers wear body cameras during some joint operations with federal agents, lifting a ban that had long frustrated local agencies, department officials said.

title: EU Extends Brexit Deadline to Jan. 31
summary: Extension is flexible, meaning U.K. can leave earlier if deal is ratified; Parliament to vote on December election. title: FCC Answers The Threat From Huawei
summary: The commission plans a vote on new restrictions of its 5G equipment.. title: Fannie, Freddie Told to Prepare for Return to Private Sector

title: Former Sen. Kay Hagan Dies

summary: Representative is 22nd GOP lawmaker to resign or announce plans to retire from House during current session. Longtime Oregon Rep. Greg Walden, the top Republican on the House Energy and Commerce Committee, said Monday that he plans to retire at the end of his current term.

title: Virgin Galactic's Quest Could Get Bumpier

title: Why Department Stores Are Becoming...Restaurants
summary: As retail sales continue to slow, stores like Nordstrom, Crate & Barrel and Tiffany & Co. are investing in eateries to give shoppers a new reason to come through their doors. title: Step Toward Parole of Child Murderer Sparks Outrage in Belgium

summary: Neither consumers nor businesses are responding as forcefully to Federal Reserve rate cuts as they used to. Federal Reserve rate cuts ain't what they used to be.

title: The Great, Useless Tom Brady Freakout of 2019
summary: Resume Subscription. Next year, Tom Brady will be a Bear. Or a Raider. Or a Cowboy. Or a Jet. Why not? title: Argentina Tightens Access to Dollars After Election
summary: Central bank ramps up capital controls ahead of transfer of power to Peronists. BUENOS AIRES-Argentina's government imposed stricter capital controls to protect its foreign-currency reserves a day after voters returned the leftist Peronist movement to power in a defeat for pro-business President Mauricio Macri.

title: In Pro-Trump West Virginia Coal Country, the Jobs Keep Leaving
summary: Miners still largely support the president but aren't expecting Washington to come to the rescue. WHITMAN, W.Va.-George Adkins and other miners now spend their shifts pulling equipment from an underground coal mine before it closes in December.

title: HSBC to 'Remodel' After Fall in Third-Quarter Profit
summary: Bank needs to simplify its structure and revamp some of its operations, says interim CEO. LONDON- HSBC Holdings PLC abandoned one of its main financial targets for 2020 and said it would embark on a new round of restructuring as tougher market conditions hit its third-quarter earnings.

title: As Catalans Protest for Secession, a Division Widens at Home
summary: Resume Subscription. BARCELONA-As marchers for Catalan independence filled the center of this prosperous Mediterranean port city, on its outskirts Esther Fernández watched them on TV with contempt.

title: Earlier Breaks With Trump Linger in North Carolina Senate Race
summary: Sen. Thom Tillis, considered vulnerable in 2020, aligns closely with the president. WHITEVILLE, N.C.-Republican Sen. Thom Tillis is in lockstep with President Trump these days on everything from impeachment to Syria. But he hasn't always been.

title: In HSBC Cleanup, Interim Chief Plans for the Long Haul
summary: Disappointing third-quarter results give the bank's caretaker CEO the chance to make his mark. As HSBC posted a disappointing set of third-quarter results, the bank's caretaker chief executive, Noel Quinn, is acting the part of the permanent CEO. He has promised to deliver in February new targets and a plan to overhaul the business. That assumes he is still in charge.

title: Wisconsin Democrats Make Early Push to Take On Trump
summary: Promise by Trump in 2016 to revitalize manufacturing resonated in competitive state. Wisconsin Democrats are planning a show of force ahead of the 2020 election in a state crucial to President Trump's re-election bid that is showing signs of stress from his trade wars.

title: How Netflix's Scott Stuber Is Reshaping the Way We Watch Movies
summary: A day in the life of the producer, who heads up Netflix's original film division. On a sun-soaked L.A. morning, Scott Stuber has a few calls to make. In the passenger seat of a black Chevy Suburban, Netflix's head of original films pops in a set of earbuds and digs in. Forty-five minutes later, after traveling from his home in Pacific Palisades to Netflix's Hollywood headquarters, Stuber has powered through a list that, for most people, would constitute an entire workday. "The longer commute is good for getting a bit of housekeeping out of the way," he says. "That way I can enter the office with some semblance of context."

title: Hearings on Single-Payer Health-Care Plans Draw Crowds Around New York
summary: Advocates hope that the number of personal and painful stories shared during the hearings will build momentum to pass the legislation. New Yorkers are waiting hours and lining up down the street to tell state legislators the same refrain: fix health care.

title: Falling Rates Boost Mortgage Market to Precrisis Levels
summary: Lenders extended $700 billion of home loans in the July-to-September quarter. The mortgage market turned red hot over the summer, posting its biggest three months since the financial crisis.

title: Why LVMH Proposed to Poorer Rival Tiffany
summary: The offer comes as the valuation gap between the brands approaches an all-time high. Louis Vuitton's owner will be marrying down in any union with jeweler Tiffany & Co., but a relatively cheap valuation makes the tie-up more appealing.

title: Why Eddie Murphy Is Still a Legend
summary: One of America's most beloved performers, Eddie Murphy has been making audiences laugh since he was a teenager. Eddie Murphy was 19 years old in 1980 when he exploded into the American consciousness on Saturday Night Live, bringing urban sass, pop-culture insight and wicked wit to characters like Gumby, Mister Robinson and Buckwheat, while in the process reviving the flagging comedy franchise. Two years later he co-starred in 48 Hrs., in which he walked into a white country-western bar, took the measure of its patrons and walked out a movie star. After his 1983 stand-up special, Delirious, Murphy became as ubiquitous as superstar peers Michael Jackson, Prince and Madonna, making blockbuster movies (Beverly Hills Cop, Coming to America) and selling out concert venues. As a comedian and an African-American, Murphy pushed boundaries, opened doors and made millions. Next year will mark Murphy's 40th as an entertainer, and it's shaping up to be a big one.

title: Stocks to Watch: Tiffany, AT&T, Walgreens, Microsoft, and More
summary: Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively Monday. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Monday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: Argentina's Peronist Repeat
summary: The ill-governed nation hands the government back to the left.. The cliche is that democracies get the government they deserve, but we're not sure Argentina deserves the left-wing government it elected Sunday. Argentines routed incumbent Mauricio Macri, but in electing Alberto Fernández as the next President and Cristina Kirchner as Vice President they are trusting the same Peronist Party that has ruined the economy before.

title: Hope Springs Eternal for Lyft and Uber Investors
summary: Ride-hailing stocks got a boost on a far-fetched goal last week. That could backfire.. Rough public waters seem to have ride-hailers and their investors reaching for virtually any kind of flotation device-even one riddled with holes.

title: CMO Titles Will Continue to Wane, and That's a Good Thing, Analysts Say
summary: Eliminating the CMO role can help companies take marketing more seriously. Chief marketing officer positions are likely to diminish in number again next year, but the trend may actually benefit companies' efforts to sell products and services.

title: China's Unicorn Population Flourishes, but for How Long?
summary: China's total number of venture-backed companies with valuations over $1 billion tops U.S.'s. There hasn't been much good news for unicorns in the U.S. recently. Things aren't much better for these magical creatures in China either.

title: Does Your Boss Have Your Back When a Loved One Dies?
summary: Most Popular News. A little over a year ago, a kitchen shelf in Laura Madaio's Boston home collapsed for no apparent reason, cascading mugs and plates onto the counter and crushing her smartphone.

title: 'Tis the Season for Surge Robots as Holiday Hiring Finds Automation
summary: Retail warehouse operations are turning to 'cobots' to help seasonal workers cope with the expected flood of online orders. The holiday hiring frenzy is under way and robots are joining the rush to seasonal jobs.

title: Intraparty Disputes Dim Outlook for Drug-Price Legislation
summary: White House, Congress seek action this year, but conflicts and possible impeachment present logistical hurdles. WASHINGTON-House members who pledged to lower drug prices are confronting the prospect that intraparty divides and possible impeachment proceedings may prevent them from getting anything major done this year.

title: Tech Firms Ramp Up Lobbying as Antitrust Scrutiny Grows
summary: Facebook, Amazon lead the pack in spending as the industry seeks to present a positive message to Washington.

title: Local Governments Try to Regulate Guns With High Tax
summary: A fight in Tacoma, Wash., over a new proposal for a high tax, joining a handful of other towns. Tacoma, Wash., could soon become one of a handful of U.S. cities to levy high taxes on gun sales, opening a new front in the battle over how much power local governments have to regulate firearms.

title: The $4 Trillion ETF Industry Is Creating More 'Roadkill'
summary: Many asset managers say the industry is entering a new phase of competition and oversaturation that threatens to squeeze out smaller funds. Exchange-traded funds have swelled into a $4 trillion juggernaut over the past quarter of a century, but many asset managers say the industry is entering a new phase of competition and oversaturation that threatens to squeeze out smaller funds.

title: Google Investors Search for Momentum Outside of Search
summary: Parent Alphabet's stock is roughly flat since last earnings report. Google parent Alphabet Inc. is scheduled to announce third-quarter earnings after the market closes on Monday. Here is what you need to know:

title: Tiffany Receives $14.5 Billion Takeover Offer From LVMH
summary: French company is seeking to double down on jewelry, one of the fastest-growing businesses in the luxury sector. Tiffany & Co. has received a takeover approach from LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton, which is seeking to add the iconic U.S. jeweler to its portfolio of upscale brands.

title: Northern California Wildfire Grows Overnight, Forcing Evacuations
summary: California governor declares state of emergency as fierce winds stoke fires. PETALUMA, Calif.-California's governor declared a state of emergency as a wildfire north of San Francisco burned nearly uncontrolled and millions of people were left without power as utilities tried to prevent more fires amid raging winds.

title: Trump Administration to Allow Thousands of Salvadorans to Remain in U.S. for Extra Year
summary: Central American nation sought extension of protection, which U.S. said it planned to cancel last year. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration extended temporary protected status for more than 250,000 Salvadorans living in the U.S. through January 2021, and will offer them an additional year of protection once a court battle over the matter concludes.
